info.title: SuperOffice Agent API v1
info.termsOfService: You must be an authorized user to access this API.

post.summary: Get information about a script from a unique identifier
post.description:
NsApiSlow threshold: 5000 ms.
<para />## Online Restricted: ## The CRMScript agent is not available in Online by default. Access must be requested specifically when app is registered.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: UniqueIdentifier

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Optional comma separated list of properties to include in the result. Other fields are then nulled out to reduce payload size: "Name,department,category". Default = show all fields.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code.

parameters.name: SO-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code. Overrides Accept-Language value.

parameters.name: SO-Culture
parameters.description: Number, date formatting in a specified culture (iso2 language) code. Partially overrides SO-Language/Accept-Language value. Ignored if no Language set.

parameters.name: SO-TimeZone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone code that you would like date/time responses converted to.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

post.summary: Create or Update the CRMScript information
post.description:
NsApiSlow threshold: 5000 ms.
<para />## Online Restricted: ## The CRMScript agent is not available in Online by default. Access must be requested specifically when app is registered.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: UniqueIdentifier, Crmscript

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Optional comma separated list of properties to include in the result. Other fields are then nulled out to reduce payload size: "Name,department,category". Default = show all fields.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code.

parameters.name: SO-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code. Overrides Accept-Language value.

parameters.name: SO-Culture
parameters.description: Number, date formatting in a specified culture (iso2 language) code. Partially overrides SO-Language/Accept-Language value. Ignored if no Language set.

parameters.name: SO-TimeZone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone code that you would like date/time responses converted to.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

parameters.description: TriggerScriptUniqueId

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Optional comma separated list of properties to include in the result. Other fields are then nulled out to reduce payload size: "Name,department,category". Default = show all fields.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code.

parameters.name: SO-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code. Overrides Accept-Language value.

parameters.name: SO-Culture
parameters.description: Number, date formatting in a specified culture (iso2 language) code. Partially overrides SO-Language/Accept-Language value. Ignored if no Language set.

parameters.name: SO-TimeZone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone code that you would like date/time responses converted to.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.CRMScript.description: GetCRMScriptByUniqueIdentifier: Get information about a script from a unique identifier

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Script.description:
The Script Service. The service implements all services working with the CRMScript object without reference to primary keys. Primarily used by VSCode integration.
<para />
Carrier object for Script.
Services for the Script Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ICRMScriptAgent">CRMScript Agent</see>.

Description.description: Optional description of what this script is used for.

IncludeId.description: A unique name used for including this script in another

Path.description: Path to script in the hierarchy.

BlockedVerbs.description: The verbs that are blocked when calling a ejscript over HTTP

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.TableRight.description:
Wraps a table right together with an explanatory reason.
Code can indicate why access is restricted.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldProperty.description: Class holding properties like field length, field type about a field in the carrier.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldRight.description:
Wraps the field right together with an explanatory reason.
Also adds logical operators to the field rights so that they can be easily combined.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.CRMScript.description: SaveCRMScriptByUniqueIdentifier: Create or Update the CRMScript information
DeleteCRMScriptByUniqueIdentifier: Delete the CRMScript

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.CRMScriptEntity.description:
CRM Scripts - stored in the ejScript table, including source code.
<para />
Carrier object for CRMScriptEntity.
Services for the CRMScriptEntity Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ICRMScriptAgent">CRMScript Agent</see>.

Description.description: Optional description of what this script is used for.

IncludeId.description: A unique name used for including this script in another

AccessKey.description: Access key used to run this script on the customer pages

HierarchyId.description: The script is inside this hierarchy folder

SourceCode.description: Contains the source code of the script

HtmlOutput.description: True if this script will return HTML output

Includes.description: The unique ids of all depencies of this script (all resolved includes)

SourceMaps.description: The source maps for this script

ValidationResult.description: The result of a validation of a TypeScript when saving

BlockedVerbs.description: The verbs that are blocked when calling a ejscript over HTTP

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.CRMScriptSource.description:
Object for returning source-map info when validating or executing a CRMScript
<para />
Carrier object for CRMScriptSourceMap.
Services for the CRMScriptSourceMap Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ICRMScriptAgent">CRMScript Agent</see>.

LineNumberFrom.description: The 1-based start line (inclusive) of this entry

LineNumberTo.description: The 1-based end line (inclusive) of this entry

Delta.description: The delta between global line number and a line number inside this range

IncludedFrom.description: The list of IncludeId:linenum that leads to this source

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.CRMScriptResult.description:
Object for returning information when validating a CRMScript
<para />
Carrier object for CRMScriptResult.
Services for the CRMScriptResult Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ICRMScriptAgent">CRMScript Agent</see>.

Valid.description: True if the CRMScript was successfully validated. If false, see the error message for details

ErrorMessage.description: Deprecated, see ErrorInformation instead. Contains the error message for a non-valide CRMScript

LineNumber.description: Deprecated, see ErrorInformation instead. The line number containing the incorrect syntax, if available

ErrorInformation.description: Contains error information if the validation failed

Transpiled.description: This will contain transpiled code. In case of Typescript, this will then contain the executable JavaScript

Includes.description: The unique ids of all depencies of this script (all resolved includes)

SourceMaps.description: Array of source maps showing where in the original code a specific line originated from

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.CRMScriptErrorI.description:
Object containing error information for a CRMScript
<para />
Carrier object for CRMScriptErrorInfo.
Services for the CRMScriptErrorInfo Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ICRMScriptAgent">CRMScript Agent</see>.

ErrorMessage.description: Descriptive message of the script failed

IncludeId.description: The includeId of the source where the error occured

LineNumber.description: The line number where the error occured

CharacterPosition.description: The character position on the ErrorLine, if available

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.CRMScript.description: SaveCRMScriptEntityWithoutCompile: Save the script directly without compiling TypeScript
ExecuteScript: Execute a CRMScript with parameters, returning printed output value.
ExecuteScriptByIncludeId: Execute a CRMScript with parameters, returning printed output value.
ExecuteScriptByUniqueId: Execute a CRMScript with parameters, returning printed output value.
ExecuteScriptAsEvent: Execute a CRMScript with event data as input. Returns event data with output variable values.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.EventData.description:
EventData containing data related to event handlers
<para />
Carrier object for EventData.
Services for the EventData Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ICustomerServiceAgent">CustomerService Agent</see>.

Type.description: The type of event we are triggered by

InputValues.description: Environment values sent to the event handler

BlockExecution.description: Whether the context should stop what it is doing, e.g. saving a sale

NavigateTo.description: Where the context should naviate afterwards

Message.description: A message to be presented to the user

ShowDialog.description: JSON structure of dialog to show

OutputValues.description: Values sent back to the environment from the event handler

Exception.description: String containing error message from handler system if it failed

ParserValues.description: Parser values sent to the event handler

CgiVariables.description: Cgi variables sent by some events

CgiContent.description: The Cgi content/body, sent by some events

Headers.description: Incoming headers if sent by the context which the script is executed from

TraceExecution.description: If true, then the execution will be traced

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.CRMScript.description: ExecuteScriptAsEventByUniqueId: Execute a CRMScript with event data as input. Returns event data with output variable values.
ValidateScript: Validate a CRMScript. This will check that the syntax is correct
ValidateScriptByIncludeId: Validate a CRMScript. This will check that the syntax is correct
ValidateScriptByUniqueId: Validate a CRMScript. This will check that the syntax is correct
ExecuteScriptByString: Execute a CRMScript 2 (JavaScript), returning the printed output value.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.CRMScriptRunRes.description:
Object for returning result from a CRMScript
<para />
Carrier object for CRMScriptRunResult.
Services for the CRMScriptRunResult Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ICRMScriptAgent">CRMScript Agent</see>.

Output.description: The output from the script, normally from a print or printLine statement

Parameters.description: The parameters/variables that might have been modified by the script

TraceRun.description: Contains the trace information from the script execution

Eventdata.description: The EventData instance after script execution with output values

Success.description: Indicates if the script was executed successfully, or if it failed. In case of failing, the error members will contain more information

ErrorInformation.description: Contains error information if the execution failed

StatusCode.description: The status code which is available to be returned from Typescript scripts

StatusMessage.description: An additional status message that can be sent along with the status code

Headers.description: Optional result headers for context that supports it

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.CRMScriptTraceR.description:
Object for returning Trace run result from a CRMScript
<para />
Carrier object for CRMScriptTraceRun.
Services for the CRMScriptTraceRun Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ICRMScriptAgent">CRMScript Agent</see>.

PeakMemory.description: The maximum amount of used memory during execution (in kB)

FileSize.description: The size of the trace file

AssociateId.description: Associate who the script was executed as

Status.description: The status of the script, or exception if it fails

Frames.description: The frames of the the trace

ForceSaveTrace.description: This trace should be saved even if script_trace.exception_only is true.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.CRMScript.description: ValidateScriptByString: Validate a CRMScript 2 (JavaScript). This will check that the syntax is correct
ResolveIncludes: Will resolve all includes for a TypeScript and return an array of the IDs

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TriggerScriptEn.description:
CRM Trigger Script - The script runs when a given event fires.
<para />
Carrier object for TriggerScriptEntity.
Services for the TriggerScriptEntity Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ICRMScriptAgent">CRMScript Agent</see>.

Name.description: Optional description of what this script is used for.

ScreenType.description: Event id that triggers script.  See EventHandlerType enum.

Enabled.description: Whether this screen chooser is enabled or not

Source.description: The CRMscript code for this event handler

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.CRMScript.description: GetTriggerScriptByUniqueId: Get a trigger CRMScript.
SaveTriggerScriptByUniqueId: Validate a CRMScript. This will check that the syntax is correct
DeleteTriggerScriptByUniqueId: Delete a trigger CRMScript.
ValidateTriggerScript: Validate a Trigger CRMScript. This will check that the syntax is correct, but not execute the script.
ValidateTriggerScriptByUniqueId: Validate a Trigger CRMScript. This will check that the syntax is correct, but not execute the script.

SuperOffice Password.description:
SuperOffice username:password are passed in Base64-encoded. 

You can also pass inn an unencoded ticket 7T:abc== with the HTTP Authenticate header.

SuperId Authentication.description:
SuperOffice SuperId OAuth implicit flow. 
You need to issue a request to the SuperId authorization URL
    https://online.superoffice.com/login/common/oauth/authorize?response_type=token
      &client_id=670734e0-4c5a-11e3-be9e-a171392e81db
      &redirect_uri=https://example.com/spa/

passing in the application id and redirect URL.

SuperId will log the user in, and redirect to the requested redirect URL with a #payload
containing the access token and claims. (The redirect URL must be registered with SuperId in advance)

   https://example.com/spa#access_token=8A%3aCust12227.AXRrCITpPBvQX3UbIohb
      &token_type=bearer
      &state=
      &expires_in=3600
      &ctx=Cust12227
      &netserver_url=https%3a%2f%2fsod.superoffice.com%2fCust12227%2fRemote%2fServices82%2f

You can take the #access_token value and pass it as the Authenticate HTTP header as a BEARER token.

externalDocs.description: The SuperOffice DevNet Community has more documentation, examples, and discussion forums.
